Module com.example.fitnesschaingui
Package com.example.fitnesschaingui

Class Family

java.lang.Object
com.example.fitnesschaingui.Member
com.example.fitnesschaingui.Family
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Member>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Premium
public class Family extends Member
Represents Family memberships at the fitness chain. Inherits from Member class and adds functionality for guest passes.

  • Constructor Details

    • Family

      public Family(String fName, String lName, Date dob, Location location)
      Constructs Family object. Calls super to construct Member object, then sets expiration date to the correct value and initializes guestPasses.
      Parameters:
      fName - first name of the membership holder.
      lName - last name of the membership holder.
      dob - date of birth of the membership holder.
      location - where the membership is held.

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Represents the Family membership as a string. Prints information for a standard membership along with a Family identifier and the number of remaining guest passes.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Member
      Returns:
      string containing information about the membership.

    • membershipFee

      public double membershipFee(boolean first)
      Calculates the fee owed for the membership. Adds the starting fee to the monthly cost of a Family membership multiplied by the number of months the membership lasts for.
      Overrides:
      membershipFee in class Member
      Returns:
      the membership fee.

    • useGuestPass

      public void useGuestPass()
      Decrements the available number of guest passes. Checks whether the member has a guest pass currently is available and updates the number of available passes if so.

    • returnPass

      public void returnPass()
      Gives the member back a guest pass. Increases the number of available guest passes by one.

    • hasPass

      public boolean hasPass()
      Checks if the member has a pass available. Compares to see if the number of available guest passes is greater than zero.
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one available guest pass, false otherwise.
